hero.content: A hilariously funny twist on classic pizza soup! Pineapple is the unexpected star, adding a tropical touch to this hearty and comforting meal. Prepare to be left with a delightful combination of flavors and a touch of humor in your mouth.

body.content:
1 can (14 ounces) diced pineapple  
1 medium onion, diced  
2 cloves garlic, minced  
1 tablespoon olive oil  
1 teaspoon dried oregano  
1 teaspoon dried basil  
1 can (14 ounces) crushed tomatoes  
1/2 cup chicken broth  
1/2 cup heavy cream  
Salt and pepper, to taste  
Chopped fresh basil (optional)  
Crated Parmesan cheese (optional)  
Extra pineapple chunks (optional)

1. Preheat your oven to broil. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and set aside.
  2. In a large soup pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the diced onion and minced garlic. Sauté until the onion is translucent, about 5 minutes.
  3. Stir in the dried oregano and basil. Cook for about 30 seconds to release their flavors.
  4. Pour in the crushed tomatoes, chicken broth, and heavy cream. Add the diced pineapple to the pot as well.
  5. Bring the soup to a boil. Then, reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and let it simmer for 20-25 minutes.
  6. Season the soup with salt and pepper, to taste. If you're feeling fancy, you can also add a pinch of red pepper flakes for a kick.
  7. While the soup is simmering, broil the pineapple chunks on the prepared baking sheet for 5-7 minutes. You want them to turn golden brown and start to caramelize.
  8. Once the soup is ready, taste it and adjust the seasoning as needed.
  9. Serve the Pineapple Pizza Soup hot and garnished with the shredded Parmesan cheese, chopped fresh basil, and/or the melted pineapple chunks.

question.prompt: Which of the following isn't a benefit of pineapple?

choices.justification: Noted confidence boosts are only anecdotal at this time
The surprising flavor is a hit
